cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles SSW of Caibarién, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Turning west-northwest tonight and northwest Saturday–Monday, tracking just west of the Florida Keys, up the eastern Gulf and coming ashore over the Florida Panhandle before moving inland across the Southeast U.S.

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in Mid-Atlantic or Northeast; limited to SW Florida coast.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings confined to Florida Keys and Florida Bay.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, west coast of Florida, Florida Panhandle, and eventually the interior Southeast; Mid-Atlantic and New York coast remain outside impact zone.
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no Northeast locations listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for New York Harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant low may bring periods of rain mid-week (generally 1–2 inches, locally higher).
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor visibility reductions and slick surfaces from rainfall; no significant marine hazards anticipated.
